alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 5:25PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Brown, Kewaunee, southern Door, southeastern Calumet and Manitowoc Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 525 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Algoma to near Denmark to 11 miles northeast of Brillion to near Chilton. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Algoma, Two Creeks and Camp Rokilio Scout Camp around 540 PM CDT. Manitowoc around 550 PM CDT. Cleveland around 555 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Krok, Maribel, Larrabee, Curran, Slovan, Wayside, Gregorville, Rankin, Kiel and Newtonberg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
